## Variables

### DefaultMaxUsesToExplore {#ab90cfa3cc4beb814657c52b79b07c12e}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>cl::opt&lt; unsigned &gt; DefaultMaxUsesToExplore(&quot;capture-tracking-max-uses-to-explore&quot;, cl::Hidden, cl::desc(&quot;Maximal number of uses to explore.&quot;), cl::init(100))</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
The default value for MaxUsesToExplore argument.

It&#39;s relatively small to keep the cost of analysis reasonable for clients like BasicAliasAnalysis, where the results can&#39;t be cached. TODO: we should probably introduce a caching CaptureTracking analysis and use it where possible. The caching version can use much higher limit or don&#39;t have this cap at all.

Definition at line <a href="#l00047">47</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/capturetracking-cpp">CaptureTracking.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>

<Link id="l00007" /><CodeLine lineNumber="7"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00008" /><CodeLine lineNumber="8"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00009" /><CodeLine lineNumber="9"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This file contains routines that help determine which pointers are captured.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00010" /><CodeLine lineNumber="10"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// A pointer value is captured if the function makes a copy of any part of the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00011" /><CodeLine lineNumber="11"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// pointer that outlives the call.  Not being captured means, more or less, that</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00012" /><CodeLine lineNumber="12"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// the pointer is only dereferenced and not stored in a global.  Returning part</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00013" /><CodeLine lineNumber="13"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// of the pointer as the function return value may or may not count as capturing</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00014" /><CodeLine lineNumber="14"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// the pointer, depending on the context.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00015" /><CodeLine lineNumber="15"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00016" /><CodeLine lineNumber="16"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//===----------------------------------------------------------------------===//</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="59" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/capturetracker/#a684899edefe864cb9411de38e995986c"><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/capturetracker/#a684899edefe864cb9411de38e995986c">CaptureTracker::isDereferenceableOrNull</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;O, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/datalayout">DataLayout</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armslshardening-cpp/#ad467c4ab9119043f9b7750ab986be61a">DL</a>) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00060" /><CodeLine lineNumber="60"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// We want comparisons to null pointers to not be considered capturing,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="61"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// but need to guard against cases like gep(p, -ptrtoint(p2)) == null,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00062" /><CodeLine lineNumber="62"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// which are equivalent to p == p2 and would capture the pointer.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="63"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="64"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// A dereferenceable pointer is a case where this is known to be safe,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00065" /><CodeLine lineNumber="65"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// because the pointer resulting from such a construction would not be</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="66"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// dereferenceable.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="67"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00068" /><CodeLine lineNumber="68"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// It is not sufficient to check for inbounds GEP here, because GEP with</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="69"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// zero offset is always inbounds.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00070" /><CodeLine lineNumber="70"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> CanBeNull, CanBeFreed;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00071" /><CodeLine lineNumber="71"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> O-&gt;getPointerDereferenceableBytes(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armslshardening-cpp/#ad467c4ab9119043f9b7750ab986be61a">DL</a>, CanBeNull, CanBeFreed);</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00150" /><CodeLine lineNumber="150"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00151" /><CodeLine lineNumber="151"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Find the &#39;earliest&#39; instruction before which the pointer is known not to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00152" /><CodeLine lineNumber="152"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// be captured. Here an instruction A is considered earlier than instruction</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00153" /><CodeLine lineNumber="153"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// B, if A dominates B. If 2 escapes do not dominate each other, the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00154" /><CodeLine lineNumber="154"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// terminator of the common dominator is chosen. If not all uses cannot be</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00155" /><CodeLine lineNumber="155"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// analyzed, the earliest escape is set to the first instruction in the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00156" /><CodeLine lineNumber="156"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// function entry block.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00157" /><CodeLine lineNumber="157"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// NOTE: Users have to make sure instructions compared against the earliest</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00158" /><CodeLine lineNumber="158"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// escape are not in a cycle.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00159" /><CodeLine lineNumber="159" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-capturetracking-cpp-/earliestcaptures"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">struct </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-capturetracking-cpp-/earliestcaptures/#a2173e1b9b7c907c560fa9326b2a2352c">EarliestCaptures</a> : </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">public</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/capturetracker">CaptureTracker</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00197" /><CodeLine lineNumber="197"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// PointerMayBeCaptured - Return true if this pointer value may be captured</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00198" /><CodeLine lineNumber="198"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// by the enclosing function (which is required to exist).  This routine can</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00199" /><CodeLine lineNumber="199"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// be expensive, so consider caching the results.  The boolean ReturnCaptures</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00200" /><CodeLine lineNumber="200"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// specifies whether returning the value (or part of it) from the function</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00201" /><CodeLine lineNumber="201"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// counts as capturing it or not.  The boolean StoreCaptures specified whether</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00202" /><CodeLine lineNumber="202"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// storing the value (or part of it) into memory anywhere automatically</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00203" /><CodeLine lineNumber="203"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// counts as capturing it or not.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00228" /><CodeLine lineNumber="228"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// PointerMayBeCapturedBefore - Return true if this pointer value may be</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00229" /><CodeLine lineNumber="229"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// captured by the enclosing function (which is required to exist). If a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00230" /><CodeLine lineNumber="230"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// DominatorTree is provided, only captures which happen before the given</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00231" /><CodeLine lineNumber="231"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// instruction are considered. This routine can be expensive, so consider</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00232" /><CodeLine lineNumber="232"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// caching the results.  The boolean ReturnCaptures specifies whether</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00233" /><CodeLine lineNumber="233"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// returning the value (or part of it) from the function counts as capturing</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00234" /><CodeLine lineNumber="234"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// it or not.  The boolean StoreCaptures specified whether storing the value</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00235" /><CodeLine lineNumber="235"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// (or part of it) into memory anywhere automatically counts as capturing it</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00236" /><CodeLine lineNumber="236"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// or not.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00237" /><CodeLine lineNumber="237" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a3693cec8e936224ad3e5748debe73b75"><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a3693cec8e936224ad3e5748debe73b75">llvm::PointerMayBeCapturedBefore</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;V, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> ReturnCaptures,</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00290" /><CodeLine lineNumber="290"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Not captured if the callee is readonly, doesn&#39;t return a copy through</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00297" /><CodeLine lineNumber="297"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The pointer is not captured if returned pointer is not captured.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00298" /><CodeLine lineNumber="298"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// NOTE: CaptureTracking users should not assume that only functions</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00310" /><CodeLine lineNumber="310"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00311" /><CodeLine lineNumber="311"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Calling a function pointer does not in itself cause the pointer to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00312" /><CodeLine lineNumber="312"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// be captured.  This is a subtle point considering that (for example)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00313" /><CodeLine lineNumber="313"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// the callee might return its own address.  It is analogous to saying</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00314" /><CodeLine lineNumber="314"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// that loading a value from a pointer does not cause the pointer to be</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00342" /><CodeLine lineNumber="342"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">case</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> Instruction::AtomicRMW: &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00343" /><CodeLine lineNumber="343"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// atomicrmw conceptually includes both a load and store from</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00344" /><CodeLine lineNumber="344"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// the same location.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00345" /><CodeLine lineNumber="345"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// As with a store, the location being accessed is not captured,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00346" /><CodeLine lineNumber="346"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// but the value being stored is.</span></CodeLine>
